intro: Pavetta renidens, commonly known as the rough pavetta, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture, giving it its common name. The flowers are small, white or pale green, and are clustered in cymes, often blooming in the early morning.
